title: NickyCedrik
author: NickyCedrik
content: Need a loan of $600 USDTRepayment Period : 1 monthRepayment Amount : $800Receiving Address USDT (ERC-20) : 0x6885fAA606dF224C6da539F078597d93e4D0Fb09If you agree to make an agreement, please leave your message, so we can agree on the conditions. And then execute it.Thank you.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.created_time: September 07, 2022, 01:21:38 PMLast edit: September 07, 2022, 01:57:56 PM by DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: NickyCedrik on September 07, 2022, 01:14:52 PMNeed a loan of $600 USDTRepayment Period : 1 monthRepayment Amount : $800Receiving Address USDT (ERC-20) : 0x6885fAA606dF224C6da539F078597d93e4D0Fb09If you agree to make an agreement, please leave your message, so we can agree on the conditions. And then execute it.Thank you.Do you have any collateral?In case you're unaware, newbies don't get non-collateralized loans here. Â Unless you have Bitcoin or some other alt-coin to offer as collateral, you are unlikely to get a loan, and more likely to get tagged as a scammer.More can be learned about collateral suggestions here:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=577765.msg6311902#msg6311902Another thing to note; unless your deal involves bitcoin this offer should be in the Alt-Coin marketplace, not here.Good luck.

comments.author: alterra57
comments.body: I'd be happy to give you this loan if there's collateral involved.

comments.author: NickyCedrik
comments.body: HelloI have read the terms and conditions, but unfortunately I don't have any bitcoin in reserve that can guarantee me the loan ðŸ˜­

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: NickyCedrik on September 07, 2022, 02:54:10 PMHelloI have read the terms and conditions, but unfortunately I don't have any bitcoin in reserve that can guarantee me the loan ðŸ˜­Sucks, but that's how things work. Collateral helps to protect the lender from fraud which has been happening from time to time otherwise without Collateral, the lenders may not be able to recover assets lost through Loan defaulting, and they would be out of business in no time.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: NickyCedrik on September 07, 2022, 02:54:10 PMHelloI have read the terms and conditions, but unfortunately I don't have any bitcoin in reserve that can guarantee me the loan ðŸ˜­The same goes for the banks, the majority of them won't allow you to get a loan if you don't have anything in collateral. But they could give you that non-collateral loan if provided that you've got a regular job or business that's stable and can assure them that they'll be able to get paid on time just as what you've said. Getting a loan through the forum from the lenders, if you lack requirements from their rules, you're unlikely to get what you're asking for the loan.

comments.author: RACToriginal
comments.body: Do you have ETH or any crypto ?
